meanings.definition: The practice of thinking or making decisions as a group in a way that discourages creativity or individual responsibility.
meanings.sent1: Groupthink can limit new ideas and personal accountability within a team.
meanings.sent2: In the meeting, groupthink led to everyone agreeing without considering other options.
meanings.sent3: The group's groupthink made them all choose the same boring project.
meanings.sent4: The team's groupthink was like a heavy fog, obscuring any unique viewpoints.
meanings.sent5: Beware of groupthink, as it can stifle innovation and hinder progress.

meanings.definition: The tendency for members of a group to conform to the opinions or decisions of the group, even if they do not agree.
meanings.sent1: When faced with groupthink, individuals may feel pressured to follow the majority.
meanings.sent2: Groupthink can sometimes lead to poor choices being made due to peer pressure.
meanings.sent3: The group's groupthink caused them to all wear mismatched socks on purpose.
meanings.sent4: The group's groupthink was a powerful magnet, pulling everyone towards the same conclusion.
meanings.sent5: The dangers of groupthink are real, as it can silence diverse perspectives and lead to bad outcomes.
